content.text: Handbook on Sport and the Environment : Objectives, analyses, evaluations, approaches to solutions, legal issues. Objectives, analyses, evaluations, approaches to solutions, legal issues: a well-understood, comprehensive inventory.
content.title_en: Handbook on Sport and the Environment : Objectives, analyses, evaluations, approaches, legal issues

content.text: Sustainable land management in the North German lowlands. Climate change and the globalization of markets are increasingly affecting our society. Sustainable land management has to take these developments into account. It has to refocus and design its goals and measures in such a way that it can flexibly react to changing conditions. In the joint project "NaLaMa-nT" the conditions were analysed for the North German lowlands in the model regions Diepholz, Uelzen, Fläming and Oder-Spree, model-based developments were estimated, adaptation needs in the agriculture, forestry and water management were identified and transsectoral criteria and indicators of sustainable land management were identified. The results provide decision-making aid to compensate for potential conflicts of interest and to initiate adaptation measures as well as transsectoral sustainability monitoring. They create resilient foundations for spatial planning and decisions in companies, administrations and politics.
content.title_en: Sustainable land management in the North German lowlands

content.text: The large Ulm rose book : use, care and varieties for every garden situation. You want roses in your garden and are looking for the right variety? With this book nothing stands in the way of your rose happiness! Rosenexperte Andreas Barlage helps you to find your way around the immense range of rose varieties and shows you which variety is best suited for your garden and purpose. From house-high rambler to small dwarf rose: For bow, wall, bed, hedge or bucket you will find exactly what you are looking for! With helpful tips from his rich experience, the author accompanies you in buying, maintaining, multiplying, cutting and treating your roses. This makes your garden a long-lasting, flowering rose paradise!
content.title_en: The large Ulm rose book : use, care and varieties for every garden situation

content.text: Photovoltaics : textbook on basics, technology and practice : with 294 pictures and 34 tables. Systematic introduction, especially for students, engineers and technicians, which ranges from basic requirements to semiconductor physics and technology to practical application, also suitable for self-study
content.title_en: Photovoltaics : textbook on basics, technology and practice : with 294 pictures and 34 tables

content.text: Linux Mint 19 : Practical knowledge for beginners and transitions. Linux Mint 19 (Tara) is the current version of a Linux distribution based on Linux Ubuntu. The author is known for his book on the previous version Linux Mint 18. The book does not require any prior knowledge from his readers. In particular, the author addresses the conversion of Windows, which is offered with Linux Mint an operating system, which is in its performance well comparable to Windows, but which is hardly exposed to hacker attacks. The author starts with a short description of Linux Mint and the installation, whereby the possibility to operate Linux Mint and Windows parallel on a computer is discussed. Further emphasis is then on the establishment of Linux Mint, the office software package LibreOffice, Linux Mint as multi-user system, Linux Mint in the cloud and data security. Many illustrations; well-prepared Didactically: hints, rules and tips are highlighted graphically. A procurement in addition to the above-mentioned edition Linux Lint 18 is recommended because of many innovations, e.g. in music management
content.title_en: Linux Mint 19 : Practical knowledge for beginners and switchovers

content.text: Excel 2019 : All-in-one-band for dummies. Already this year the author published a dummies guide to Excel 2019. This volume, like its predecessor, consists of 8 "books", but these seem to be completely revised after comparing the table of contents. The comparison between both dummies' guidebooks shows that there are some overlaps, but the present one deals with the many individual topics to the greatest extent. This volume also presents itself in the new dummies layout, but still not of advantage is the smaller font. Screenshots and illustrations support the instructions. Although this edition has 52 pages more, it is nevertheless cheaper than the previous one. Practically also as a reference work. Libraries with a scarce budget could however opt equally well for Helmut Vonhoegen: "Comprehensive manual on Excel 2019", because more extensive but cheaper. Due to the numerous changes, an exchange of the preliminary edition is advisable.
content.title_en: Excel 2019 : All-in-one band for dummies

content.text: Raspberry Pi is a small, inexpensive single-platinum computer that can be used for numerous technical projects in combination with the programming language Python. Here is a slightly revised, updated edition (3rd edition: 2016). The texts, illustrations and code lists have been largely taken over. In Chapter 9 projects have been added. The chapter Web server contains newly added information about the VNC server and the GGI script. The chapter on the extension boards OLED and HAT is completely new. Thus, this edition has 61 pages more at the same price. Furthermore, at the end of each chapter tasks with solutions are available. An exchange of the output is not necessary, for first purchase and for seasoning
content.title_en: Raspberry Pi programming with Python

content.text: Forest growth-related software systems based on TreeGrOSS - application and theoretical foundations. Against the background of changing framework conditions and increasing requirements for multifunctional forestry, decision-making for forest managers becomes increasingly complex. Computer-based forest decision-making support systems provide assistance in solving complex planning tasks and can be adapted to changing framework conditions and issues. At the North West German forest research institute, three decision-making support systems designed for different fields of application and target groups were implemented, which are continuously updated and further developed: the ForestSimulator, the ForestPlaner and the WebOperationalPlaner. All three systems are based on the TreeGrOSS forest growth library (Tree Growth Open Source Software). In this volume, the functions and operation of the three systems are described and then the models and methods used are documented and explained in detail.
content.title_en: Forest growth sound software systems based on TreeGrOSS - application and theoretical foundations

content.text: The basics for climate change-adapted urban and open spaces planning are: Wolfgang Wende, Stefanie Rößler, Tobias Krüger (ed.). The consequences of climate change can be felt in the urban areas. Volume 6 of the REGKLAM publication series summarizes the work of the project on the basis of climate change-appropriate urban development. In addition to methods, concrete research results are presented, which are directly related to the bioclimatic effects of urban development and vegetation structures. Approach points for climate change-adapted urban and open spaces planning are formulated. The spectrum of topics includes the identification of heat-sensitive urban areas, the assessment of thermal stress in various urban construction situations as well as methods for the detection of green space equipment of urban areas as a basis for the assessment of climatic performance and the effects of planning decisions.
content.title_en: Basics for climate change-adapted urban and open space planning : Wolfgang Wende, Stefanie Rößler, Tobias Krüger (eds.)

content.text: Renovation measures in our cities and municipalities : case studies ; a project of the research programme "General Residency Research" of the Federal Ministry of Transport, Building and Urban Development (BMVBS), supervised by the Federal Institute for Building, Urban and Spatial Research (BBSR) in the Federal Office for Building and Spatial Planning (BBR). The urban development promotion is a central instrument of sustainable urban development in Germany. The federal government and the Länder provide financial aid for investments in the renewal and development of cities and municipalities in order to strengthen them as an economic and residential location. Since 1971, more than 5,000 measures in more than 2,000 municipalities with around EUR 12 billion have been funded solely by federal funds.
content.title_en: Renovation measures in our cities and municipalities : case studies ; a project of the research programme "General Research for the Department" of the Federal Ministry of Transport, Building and Urban Development (BMVBS), supervised by the Federal Institute for Building, Urban and Spatial Research (BBSR) at the Federal Office for Building and Spatial Planning (BBR)

content.text: The overheads of the overheads are: the overheads are in the order of the day. The overheads are in the order of the year to get into opinion with the overheads of the overheads. The overheads are in the order of the overheads of the overheads. The overheads are in the order of the overheads of the overheads. The overheads of the overheads are in the order of the overheads. The overheads are in the order of the overheads. The overheads are in the order of the overheads. The overheads are in the order of the overheads.
content.title_en: The influence of large offshore wind farms on the North Sea and Baltic Sea - a comprehensive literature review

metadata.authors: Schroeder, Friedhelm; Clark, Suzannah; Baschek, Burkard

content.text: Life on the castle: everyday life, feuds and tournaments. Richly illustrated representation of life on and around the medieval castle: construction, distribution and tasks of the castle, knights and lords in everyday life and during the tournament or during the war, economic environment and culture. (Olaf Kaptein) The topic "castle and knight" in the children's book sector is covered with plenty. On the non-fiction market is only to refer to A. Schlunk (BA 12/03) and "Deutsche Ritter - deutsche Burgen" (BA 11/98), Maurice Keen (BA 12/99) is already considerably more demanding. According to the Tiss (Schlunk), Thorbecke now also presents a very easy-to-understand representation of life on and around the medieval castle: construction, distribution and tasks of the castle, knights and lords in everyday life and during the tournament or during the war, economic environment and culture. Rightly, drastic descriptions, scandalous and anecdotic - often reproduced from original sources - would have been revived the text well-designed for his target group (short chapters with the names in the names), but not to be described in the miniatures.
content.title_en: Life at the Castle : everyday life, feuds and tournaments

content.text: Spaces, places, borders : on the way to a sociology of space. Klappentext: The development of modernity can be described as a development from the directly surrounding spaces to the unlimited distant spaces. While in the early tribal societies a strong bond to the near space can be observed, the modernism leads precisely beyond the alternatively given spaces and opens up new horizons. The complaint about the loss of the community, the local and the tradition finds its starting point here. The present work argues that this bond of the social to the close relations of a systematic confrontation with the space in sociology stood in the way for a long time. In the passage through central sociological theoretical positions and through individual case studies, not only the effects of this privilege of proximity are shown, but also the simultaneousness of deterritorialization and reterritorialization processes, of openings and closures is investigated.
content.title_en: Spaces, places, borders : on the way to a sociology of space

content.text: The origins of human communication. Based on rich empirical material from primate and infant research and the most influential theories of language philosophy, as well as on a multitude of striking examples from human everyday communication, he presents a sophisticated multi-level model of language development in both individual historical and art historical perspective. Central artifacts in this model are gestures - showing and pantomime - which have evolved evolutionaryly as a result of the development of social cooperation among primates. In these gestures, Tomasello recognizes the original forms of human language. In order to get from these gestural preforms to complex language communication, which can then be culturally coded, traded and refined, however, another biologically anchored but exclusively human prerequisite is required: a "psychological infrastructure of shared intentionality". This ensures that people can coordinate their perceptions and intentions and make them the point of reference of their common action.
content.title_en: The Origins of Human Communication

content.text: Pharmaceutical residues in recyclates of phosphorus recovery from sewage sludges : Final report. Currently there are data gaps on pharmaceutical residues in sewage sludges and phosphorus recycling products produced from them (P-recyclates). The aim of the project was to investigate phosphorus recovery and carbonisation plants in Germany with regard to the following medicines ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin, clarithromycin, carbamazepine, 17-α-ethinylestradiol, diclofenac, cefuroxim, sulfamethoxazole, 17-β-estradiol, metoprolol and bezafibrate. The study clearly shows that phosphorus recovery processes significantly reduce the drug exposure in P-recyclates compared to the raw materials such as sewage sludge. The results were discussed at a technical workshop.
content.title_en: Residues of pharmaceutical products in recycates of phosphorus recovery from sewage sludge : Final report

metadata.authors: Jung, Rolf; Dexheimer, Kai; Stenzel, Fabian; Eißing, Michael; Mundt, Matthias; Wiesgickl, Sonja

content.text: The project "Kommhalt braucht Raumen - Integratives Wohnen mit Zuwanderern" (Cooperation needs spaces with immigrants) is a project of research on the integration of new immigrants into the urban environment. The project "Kommhalt braucht Raumen - Integratives Wohnen mit Zuwanderern" (Cooperation needs spaces - Integratives Wohnen mit Zuwanderern) (Cooperation with immigrants) is a project in which the present publication was prepared. The project was initiated to monitor the development of housing projects in isolated municipalities, which are characterised by an integrative approach by creating spaces for the coexistence of different social groups with (new) immigrants. The content of the survey was specifically targeted (see questionnaire in the annex): (1) the housing and housing situations of the new immigrants/people living in the urban environment and the integration of newly-migrated and refugees, the integration of new people was raised in the municipal population.
content.title_en: Local survey: Immigration, Housing, Neighbourhood : Report within the research project "Summary needs spaces - inclusive living with immigrants"

content.text: Environment and innovation: an evaluation of EU policies and policies. Promoting environmental innovation is an important policy objective of the European Union. However, implementation into concrete measures is still often characterised by difficulties and deficits. This is the result of a systematic study of 24 individual European policies and three EU framework strategies. The study also shows which approaches exist at EU level to promote environmental innovation more strongly.
content.title_en: Environment and innovation: an evaluation of EU policies and strategies

content.text: Since 2007 he has been working as a Head of the Research Campus Open Hybrid LabFactory. The book presents the final report of the joint project "TroPHy2". The project has developed a hybrid roll forming system that allows hybrid components to be produced from metal profiles and carbon fibers with thermoplastic matrix. This system was built in the Technical Center of the Open Hybrid LabFactory in Wolfsburg. The partners investigated and validated the necessary manufacturing processes. The aim was to develop a structurally mechanically optimized hybrid automotive component that represents the weight savings potential of hybrid materials. A weight saving of up to 44.9 % was calculated, thereby significantly exceeding the target of 25% weight savings set at the beginning of the project. The lightweight construction potential of the hybrid material was clearly highlighted. The editor Prof. Dr.-Ing. Martin Wiedemann studied aerospace technology at the Technical University of Berlin. He then conducted research in various institutes in the field of aerospace and completed his PhD in 1991.
content.title_en: Thermoplastic, roll-formed profiles in hybrid construction 2 - TroPHy2 : Research reports from the research campus Open Hybrid LabFactory

content.text: The study examines the production processes in terms of efficiency increase and cost reduction for housing that is appropriate for demand. Based on ongoing and urgent debates on strategies for demand-oriented and affordable housing, this study looks at prefabricated construction systems and considers how they can contribute to the development of sustainable housing. On the one hand, some existing systems are presented and their production methods and qualities are examined, on the other hand, an outlook on further developments, possible optimizations and potentials inherent in the prefabricated residential building. On the basis of a selection of different manufacturers, an up-to-date state of the field of industrial and serial construction is described. The companies are representative of different design methods and the use of different materials. In addition to the degree of prefabrication, which initially refers to the manufactured elements or modules and in consequence to the building as a whole product, furthermore, the topics of automation, standardization and integration of the planning and production processes are evaluated. While the offered systems to the large part have a very high prefabrication level and by standardization a comparatively high level of productivity are not established in terms of the development, these possibilities are not yet established in terms of the scope of the production.
content.title_en: PREFAB HOUSING : Investigation of production processes in order to increase efficiency and reduce costs for housing adapted to demand

content.text: Market high-speed scenarios for electric vehicles: review and outlook for 2030. The spread of electric vehicles plays an important role in achieving climate targets in the transport sector and can also contribute to greater independence of energy supply. Research into their spread is therefore of great relevance. In the context of a study for the National Platform for Electric Mobility (NPE) in 2013, high-speed scenarios for electric vehicles were launched by 2020. Almost ten years later, the working paper will compare the methodology and results with real developments. In addition, methodological innovations are being explained and an outlook on model results for 2030 is being dared to be taken under consideration in order to take into account the new policy target achievement of 15 million pure electric vehicles and the greenhouse gas reduction targets (GHG) in the light of the new policy objectives. However, many developments have been well assessed and, due to low fuel prices, no significant market penetration of electric vehicles has been seen for a long time. With numerous policy support measures and EU regulation over fleet limits, Germany was in the middle range of the 2013 range of results.
content.title_en: Market high-speed scenarios for electric vehicles : Review and outlook until 2030

content.text: In the context of the GTM, the GTM is based on the GTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM' BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM' BTM's BTM' BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM' BTM' BTM' BTM' BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM' BTM's BTM' BTM' BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM's BTM BTM's BTM's BTMs BTMs BTMs BTM BTMs BTM BTMs BTM BTM BTM BTM BTM BTM BTMs BTMs BTMs BTMs BTMs BTMs BTMs BTMs BTMs BTM BTM BTMs BTMs BTMs
content.title_en: Modeling and formal analysis of meta-ecosystems with dynamic structure using graph transformation

content.text: Further development of a drone geomagnetic system for detection of military contaminated sites in the ground : Final report : Project start: 1 September 2020, Duration: 15 month. The DBU-funded project "Development of a drone geomagnetic system for detection of military contaminated sites in the ground" focuses on the further development of the hardware and software of the measurement systems developed by ASDRO. The drone geomagnetic method for detection of metallic and conductive materials in the underground is improved and made more efficient by a fully automated flight control, a correction of sensor pendulum movement and the extension of flight duration. Test measurements on troop training stations then extensively test the system's applicability. The software on the side of the flight planning and evaluation software is improved by automation processes. Among other things, the existing "MagSurv" software is further developed to identify the theoretical field-based equipment based on the magnetic data.
content.title_en: Further development of a drone geomagnetic system for detection of military contaminated sites in the soil : Final report : Project start: 1 September 2020, Duration: 15 month

content.text: HAM-ANS on tour : Report on a USA trip. From the introduction: As in 1983, the opportunity for employees of the HAM-ANS project (Hamburger application-oriented natural language system) was also offered to conduct a lecture and information tour in the USA. In the first two weeks we visited universities and research institutes in Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Pasadena, Santa Monica, Marina del Rey, Stanford and Dallas and last week the COLING-84 congress in Stanford (10th International Conference on Computational Linguistics).
content.title_en: HAM-ANS on tour : Report on a trip to the USA

content.text: Music (education) and its effect: a long-term study at Berlin primary schools. Under the direction of the Frankfurt music teacher Prof. Dr. Hans Günther Bastian, a long-term study was conducted at Berlin primary schools between 1992 and 1998 "On the influence of extended music education on the general and individual development of children". The research project - funded by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research - comprised more than 100 test missions and the evaluation of over one million data. The partly frapping results are now available. Extended music education influences the personality development of primary school children extremely positively. In detail - a significant improvement in social competence, - an increase in learning and performance motivation, - an important IQ gain, - a compensation of concentration weaknesses, - a promotion of musical performance and creativity, - an improvement of emotional sensitivities, - a reduction of fearful life, - an above average good school performance despite temporal multi-load, etc. The study provides in addition to the well-known music immanent justifications of the school music, - an important argument for the educational process, a solid learning of the music-based instrument.
content.title_en: Music (education) and its impact : a long-term study at Berlin primary schools

content.text: Sustainability in ecology: ways to a future-oriented world. The most pressing problems of an environment oriented towards sustainability are gathered here. The volume is based on a public lecture series organized by the Research Institute for Philosophy Hannover. The focus is on the concept of sustainability, which has been widely and often quite blurredly used since the 1992 Environmental Summit in Rio, for which environmental sciences are of central importance. From a very different perspective, i.e. from renowned experts from various disciplines, it is examined and put to the test. In their texts the authors (biologists, politicians, theologians, philosophers, historians, economists) examine questions, articulate demands, describe conditions. To the current debate a profound title, indispensable for large public libraries. (Helga Lüdtke) Presentation of the global environmental problem, balance and perspectives, the basic principles of theoretical ecology, sustainable economy, dealing with complex environmental problems, theological perspectives, etc. (Helga Lüdtke)
content.title_en: Sustainability in ecology: ways to a sustainable world

content.text: The Africa-Lexikon : a continent in 1000 keywords; with 101 illustrations, maps and tables. The long-awaited, ambitious book of the Cameroonian editor, his sign in Berlin teaching political scientist and philosopher, informs comprehensively about Africa (including the Arab North) as the 1st German-language dictionary. Around 200 renowned scientists have written the compact, yet well-understood individual contributions. These are each provided with references to further literature. Not only country reports, but also articles from everyday life, history, politics, law and economy, art, literature, language, philosophy, religion, sciences, technology and media. Given many still prevailing clichés and generally lack of knowledge about Africa, this book leaves virtually no questions open. Too bad that for reasons of space, it had to be dispensed with the biographies of African personalities. - Nevertheless, this Africa-Lexikon is also a worthwhile purchase for smaller libraries - despite the proud price - but also for small ones. (2 A, S) (Roland Schmitt) Umfangendes Nachbeis Aufsetzwerk zu Geschicht, Landschaft, Landschaft, Landschaft.
content.title_en: The Africa-Lexikon : one continent in 1000 keywords ; with 101 illustrations, maps and tables

content.text: Global culture: media, arts, policy, and globalization. McDonalds, MTV & Co. have no longer been able to use terra incognita until the last corners of the world, and the volume's contributions investigate how and with what success states, cities and public and private cultural organizations are trying to intervene in processes of cultural globalization. The first part is about differences and similarities between cultural policies in Europe, the United States and Asia. Thus, the cultural policy of France, Sweden and the United States is compared from the perspective of private and public cultural promotion and the development of Japanese cultural policy and orientation towards Western models. The second part is about the regeneration of broken cultural resources in cities that had suffered economic losses. For example, the effect of a cultural and economic upturn is examined by the establishment of new museums in cities such as Liverpool, Marseille and Barcelona. Another contribution analyses the positive effect of globalization on local music traditions, as it is to be seen in Brazil. The third part of the study of the cultural culture series, which is to be seen in the fourth part of the article on the cultural culture series, and in the fourth part of the article on the American culture.
content.title_en: Global culture : media, arts, policy, and globalization

content.text: Research on the international state and development of alternative water systems : BMBF research project No. 02 WA 0074. Alternative water systems, EcoSan, Decentralized water systems, grey water recycling, commercial water use, waste water recycling, nutrient recovery, membrane technology
content.title_en: Study on the international status and development of alternative water systems : BMBF research project No. 02 WA 0074

content.text: The survey results of the survey are based on the methodology used in the analysis of the individual actions of individuals. Individuals are given certain characteristics (preferences) which are not lost or changed even when interacting with other individuals. In the background of the study is the question whether in Germany or in other countries more academics are needed at all, whether there is additional financing need, whether the state provides sufficient funding and whether a shift of part of the funding to the private side improves the situation or leads only to an accelerated withdrawal of the state from funding. Structure: 1. Preliminary remarks on the method of study. - 2. The problem. - 3. The positive external effects of the state universities and the state financing of the study (a. point of departure: knowledge expansion. - b. Higher education and economic growth.
content.title_en: Tuition fees and their social impact: an analysis of data from the USA, England, Scotland, the Netherlands, Austria, Australia and New Zealand

content.text: Living healthier - living more harmoniously : room inspirations for well-being. How trees can be designed to meet the demands of harmonious and healthy living is illustrated in this informative text illustrated by practical examples. Much green, right light, matching colors, soothing water and fragrances as well as the best traditions of eastern and western living traditions are combined here. Facilities that promote harmony and relaxation, ideas for the vitalization of rooms and to avoid allergies triggering substances are shown. Health holistically, is an important concern of the author, and aspects of environmental and resource protection are also illuminated. No particular living style is in the foreground, the topic is transferable to apartments of various kinds. In times of wellness and wellness waves, this volume will surely find a strong appeal. (2)
content.title_en: Living healthier - living more harmoniously : room inspirations to feel good

content.title_en: Success factor Location planning : correct assessment of domestic and foreign locations ; with 40 tables

content.text: In the first part of the volume, the position is presented as an integrated, flexible and social-space-oriented education aid, as well as as as the results of the second part of the child's child's perspective. Integrated educational assistance: flexibility, integration and social space-relatedness in youth assistance. Integration, social space-relatedness and flexibility currently have a cyclical effect on social work. It is not always clear what this means. Is integrated flexible assistance an additional offer in the context of the differentiated youth assistance system or the concepts of flexible assistance used frequently in everyday life and in practice synonymously describe a new structural quality? The answer given in this volume, based on the INTEGRA project of the International Society for Educational Aid, is clear. It is about a new structural quality of educational assistance, to redesign a needs-oriented and flexible, regionalised youth assistance and at the same time an alternative, cooperative control and modernization strategy in relation to the current mainstream.
content.title_en: Integrated educational assistance: flexibility, integration and social space in youth assistance

content.text: Knowledge projects: Learning from a didactic, software-technical and organizational perspective. In this book, 22 authors from different disciplines describe theoretical and methodological approaches as well as their practical experiences on collaborative learning in networked contexts. The brackets of the contributions form their intensive cooperation in the research project WissPro - Knowledge project "Informatics systems in context". They describe the didactic, software-technical and organizational design of the university studies as knowledge projects. In knowledge projects, the focus is on the collaborative structure and the tradition of knowledge on a particular topic. In this context, the content cooperation is constituted by the different experiences, concerns and perspectives of the involved persons and is characterized by their continuous examination of the relevant technical systems and organizational structures. In front of this conceptual background, the book contributions discuss exemplarily different teaching and learning forms in computer science studies at the universities of Hamburg, Lübeck and Tübingen and address in particular the content-related sub-area with the embedding of computer science systems in development or application contexts.
content.title_en: Knowledge projects: collaborative learning from a didactic, software and organisational perspective

content.title_en: Diffusion processes in advanced technological materials

content.text: Management of IT projects : from planning to implementation; with 20 tables. It is always astonishing how rarely the procedures and methods of project management are consistently used. Many problem-ridden projects speak a clear language here. Knowledge of project management and its application possibilities are indispensable for IT managers and IT developers. In this book the most important methods and methods of PM are presented. The practical relevance is established by the extensive practical knowledge of the authors in the management of IT projects and results in concrete recommendations for action for the use of the project management instruments. An important chapter deals with the project policy, i.e. how IT projects are to be integrated into the company policy. TOC:Introduction.- Basic concepts of project management.- A framework for project management.- Project policy.- Management of projects.- Procedure in IT projects.- Institutional management of IT projects.- Planning of IT projects.- Project planning techniques.- Cost assessment in IT projects.- Case studies.- Strategies for the rescue of non-learning projects.- Strategies for the rescue of non-learning projects.- Management of IT projects.- Project planning techniques.-
content.title_en: Management of IT projects : from planning to implementation ; with 20 tables

metadata.authors: Mertens, Peter; Wieczorrek, Hans Wilhelm; Wieczorrek, Hans W.

content.text: Bicycles: Types and technology, fitness and leisure, training and tours. Image/text tape with tips on Rechnik, driving technology, fitness. Especially for sporty cyclist. (Rolf Raschka) The author is interested in cycling with the family, the behaviour in urban traffic and on tours (see Gunnar Fehlau: "Radreise", BA 9/03), but he is particularly interested in riders who develop ambition beyond everyday use. This starts with the technology, because many portraits of racing machines and mountain bikes of all kinds are opposed to a section on the touring bike. In addition, there are plenty of tips on sport driving technology, nutrition and fitness. The approximately 45 pages comprehensive, image-oriented section on maintenance work is partly usable for all bikes, partly only for special machines (knappe repair customer last Richard Hallett: BA 8/03). The further very common hub circuits are hardly addressed. Overall, a somewhat unbalanced representation, whose Anglo-Saxon origin is noticeable. Given the very attractive equipment and the large number of bicycles is available.
content.title_en: Bicycles : Types and techniques, Fitness and leisure, Training and tours

content.text: Cross-process project management : Foundations of successful projects. Project management has become an increasing challenge in times of tighter project budgets and project schedules.The authors give valuable assistance in crisis situations and show how a consistent line is brought into a project from the beginning. Furthermore, the various interfaces to the different disciplines in software engineering are shown. Another focus of the book is the concrete use of a tool that controls the entire process from the project manager's point of view. Other topics are reporting, crisis management, risk management and personnel management within complex projects.
content.title_en: Cross-process project management : Foundations of successful projects

content.text: Physics of semiconductor components : introductory textbook for engineers and physicists. This textbook is an introduction to the physics of semiconductor components, with emphasis on the physical basic principles. It is aimed at students of electrical and information technology and technical physics at universities of applied sciences, but also at prospective physicists who want to familiarize themselves with the applications of semiconductor physics. The basic facts and equations are presented with detailed lines. Each chapter contains calculated examples and tasks, which can be partly solved using MATLAB or similar programs (partly also on palmtops). Solution suggestions and also a compressed data and formula collection are offered on the Internet. Summaries, supplementary chapters on trends and tendencies as well as references to further literature round off the text. TOC:Basics of microphysics.-band structure and charge transport.- pn transitions.- Optoelectronic components: LEDs, photodetectors and solar cells.- Biopolar transistors.- Metal-half-conductor contacts and field effect transistors.- Semiconductor technology
content.title_en: Physics of Semiconductor Components : introductory textbook for engineers and physicists

content.text: The basic mechanisms of a operating system are analysed and objectified by means of concrete program listings of the Linux kernel. The complexity of an operating system and the impressive ingenuity of the underlying algorithm and its clever implementation in C-code are at the heart of the book. The reader thus gets a solid understanding of the system architecture and its concrete realization. The text is suitable for basic studies starting from the third semester and requires a solid understanding of the C-programming alongside basic knowledge of algorithms and data structures. TOC:Introduction.- Computer Hardware.- System Calls.- Processes and Threads.- Schedule.- Linux Schedule.- Realtime.- Time Sharing.- Load Balancing.- Storage Management.- Segmentation.- Virtual Memory.- Page Table.- Paging.- Page Swapping.- Slab Layer.- Synchronization. Kernel-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syp-Syp-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syply-Syp-Sy
content.title_en: Operating systems : a compact introduction with Linux

content.text: Introduction to semiconductor circuitry. The aim of this introductory textbook is to convey the principles and functioning of semiconductor components and circuits. On the enclosed CD-ROM are the interactive learning program S.m.i.L.E. developed at a university to illustrate the complex relationships covered in the book, as well as P-Spice files for testing the circuits from the book and the student version of the simulation program OrCAD-Pspice 9.1. The material is based on a lecture and thus is addressed to students and corresponding practitioners. Last published on the topic M. Reisch (BA 2/05) and T. Tilli (ID 2/05), which however contain both not as helpful software as this book. (3)
content.title_en: Introduction to semiconductor circuitry

content.text: Molecular Cell Biology. A must for all biology students Introduction to the fundamentals of cell biology Comprehensive presentation of molecular cell biology with further literature for advanced examination-relevant compact knowledge for the following disciplines: Molecular medicine Human medicine Molecular immunobiology Biotechnology Bioinformatics Biology-Teaching Office The new carp is compact, clear, completely didactically unbeatable (theme boxes, summary, learning questions) Exciting and super good to read top current learning made easy!
content.title_en: Molecular cell biology

content.text: Applied microbiology : with 69 tables. This textbook of the "Applied Microbiology" by G. Antranikian, Professor of Microbiology at the Technical University of Hamburg-Harburg and winner of the German Environmental Award 2004, is the first to open up this interdisciplinary and innovative cross-sectional science. Biologists, chemists, engineers and bioinformatics specialists provide information about their respective research areas within applied microbiology. The annual rate of increase in microbial products, such as chemicals, vitamins, biopolymers and fuels, is between 10 and 20 percent. The applied microbiology is thus one of the most promising research branches of the 21st century. Highly recommended. Nothing comparable on the market so far.
content.title_en: Applied microbiology : with 69 tables

content.text: The following is the same company and company.
content.title_en: Software components at a glance : Introduction, classification & comparison of JavaBeans, EJB, COM+, .Net, CORBA, UML 2

content.text: Signals - Processes - Systems : a multimedia and interactive introduction to signal processing ; with slide designs, 13 introductory videos and about 250 interactive signaling systems. Book and CD-ROM form a learning system which makes it possible to conduct research and visualize complex processes. The underlying didactic concept relies on the visualization of signals and processes as well as on the graphical programming of signaling systems. By using a professional and worldwide used software of measurement, control, control technology (DASYLab, version 8) useable applications can be developed, modified and optimized. The computer-supported processing of real signals via the sound card and the parallel port becomes possible. The English parallel output was delivered at the educational fair Digita 2003 with the German educational software award. TOC: Introduction.- The concept: Methods, contents, non-diagnosis-diagnosis-diagnosis-diagnosis-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dia-dia-dia-dia-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog-dialog
content.title_en: Signals - Processes - Systems : a multimedia and interactive introduction to signal processing; with slide designs, 13 introductory videos and about 250 interactive signaling systems

content.text: New areas of water management : Studies on drinking water and wastewater disposal in the regions of Munich, Hanover and Frankfurt (Oder). The starting point of the studies was the assumption that the three fall regions were affected by the same overall water management developments: the Europeanization, the regionalization of economic spatial references, the differentiation of consumption patterns, the development of new technical options and the commercialization, but otherwise have different framework conditions. The case studies are structured in a similar way: After a brief description of the socio-economic development of the region, the structure and the current change processes of the regional water management are presented, the spatial "key issue" is examined in depth.
content.title_en: New water management areas : Investigations into drinking water and wastewater disposal in the regions of Munich, Hanover and Frankfurt (Oder)

content.text: The first thing to do is to clarify whether you want to have it good or fun, noble or cheerful. Then you can finance and plan with the craftsmen, not to forget the temperature of the room and hot water. Checklists and advice for the right shopping as well as advice for the safety in the bathroom for children, seniors and disabled people. Finally, a wellness oasis is described. This book is not so much about the work of the DIY workers, but about the planning and cooperation with craftsmen. For DIY enthusiasts, the book "Bäder eigenausbauten und modernisieren" (BA 8/03) is recommended. In order to plan the book, you should recommend the DIY worker to do the same. (2)
content.title_en: Baths : plan, rebuild, redesign

content.text: Regional garden culture : about the identity of landscapes. The German Society for Gardening and Landscape Culture (DGGL) presents its first yearbook. - Cities discover their surroundings. Historical gardens and parks, but also the cultural landscape created over many decades, are the focus of concepts and strategies for the region. The Regional Park RheinMain, the garden landscape Ostwestfalen-Lippe and the garden dreams Sachsen-Anhalt are some examples that the German Society for Gardening and Landscape Culture takes up in its yearbook. While some regions can rely on a rich heritage of well-known and less known parks, others, such as the region Saar or the Lusatia, face great challenges in the face of decades of exploitation of the landscape for coal extraction.The book shows with which strategies the identity of these landscapes is worked out and strengthened and gives a comprehensive overview of current concepts for cultural landscape in Germany. (Information of DGGL.)
content.title_en: Regional garden culture : about the identity of landscapes

content.text: C++ with the Borland C++Builder 2007 : Introduction to the C++ standard and object-oriented Windows programming. Introduced into the development of object-oriented C++ applications including web applications. This is addressed to beginners without any prior knowledge. This is possible despite the complexity of C++ programming, as the book is based on the current version of the Borland C++ Builder. The Borland C++ Builder is an easy-to-use development environment for visual development of C++ programs. An earlier version of the Borland C++ Builder is described in detail by D. Abels (BA 1/01). The new edition (1st edition not discussed) is required by the further development of the Borland C++ Builder. Extensions and additions to the prepress concern systematic tests and unit tests, programming logic and program verification as well as object-oriented analysis and design. A focus of the presentation is on a comprehensive reference of the C++ standard (ISO/IEC 14882:2003), where all important language elements are systematically displayed.
content.title_en: C++ with Borland C++Builder 2007 : Introduction to the C++ standard and object-oriented Windows programming

content.text: City gardens : Planning - Design - Life. Publisher's text: Even cityrs know him - the dream of own green. However, they often have only small and difficult areas available. The author shows how this dream with imagination and clever planning is nevertheless realized, using 40 inspiring city gardens. These examples show how beautiful green garden rooms can also be created in the middle of the city. A book with numerous ideas, plans and expert tips for future favorite places in the city garden!
content.title_en: City gardens : Planning - Design - Life

content.text: The safety fib contains information on hazards, protective measures, regulations and codes of conduct, packaging and container markings and accident measures. (LK/N: Pleuß) Handy safety fib, which informs about benefits and dangers, about protective measures and rules of conduct when handling dangerous substances. Turns to practitioners (safety officer, manufacturer, transport specialist) and provides compact, generally understandable information. Has been extended and updated to about 35 pages (new EC directives, etc.) compared to the 4th edition 2002 (BA 1/03). An exchange of expenditures is useful. (2) (LK/N: Pleuß)
content.title_en: Handling of hazardous substances

content.text: The time of the Internet's discussionists is called "the Internet's content of the Internet" and "the Internet's content of the Internet's content of the Internet's content of the Internet's content of the Internet's content of the Internet's content of the Internet, and the Web 2.0 in particular are a blessing for freedom of expression, it says: Finally, everyone can determine what is being discussed - not only experts, top journalists and eloquent authors who claim the monopoly of opinion. But what have we been negotiating? Forum contributions that are frantic with stupidity and false facts, and with idiots hardly to be overbidden with video clips on YouTube. It is even worse: political factions and turbid muddles mask themselves more often than harmless bloggers to spread anti-democracy hectic campaigns. We find ourselves on a dangerous path, says Andrew Keen: Where half-knowledge and blanque lies prevail, because the rationality of the Internet's content of the Internet is also being used for the most reckly and absurd.
content.title_en: The hour of the Stümper: how we destroy our culture on the Internet

content.text: Machine winter: knowledge, technology, socialism; a disputing script. It is not known that machines that hire machines, but people who build and use machines are no longer acceptable that machines are increasingly deteriorating living conditions, although they were originally intended to improve them. Even in the richest countries, there is no longer much to be noticed about life relief by technology: the creative computer service provider is forging the existence of a biblical day laborer; the high-tech doctor writes expert reports on the alms entitlement of sick support recipients; any modernization of production means mass redundancies instead of reduction in working time. But not even the connection to these still comparatively luxurious forms of lamentation is allowed to the poorer regions; there is only all that can be stored out there, which can not be done with the wage-dependent Westerns at present. How can one storm the machines to take possession of them with the literary technique? Can one retain the modern division of labor, but get rid of the hierarchies, dependencies and injustices that have stuck to it? What have the industry, the imagination of its created wealth and the fantasy of its own?
content.title_en: Machine winter : knowledge, technology, socialism ; a dispute writing

content.text: Technical possibilities of alternative design of urban water and wastewater infrastructure: a technical research within the framework of the project "Transformation management for a sustainable water management. With the technology research netWORKS presents an inventory of selected national and international experiences and projects on technical possibilities of alternative design of urban water and waste disposal infrastructure. The available technical possibilities and their already realized applications are shown. Implementations were taken into account within the framework of research and pilot projects as well as already realized projects on a large scale to alternative concepts of water supply and waste water disposal. Winn operational experiences were evaluated as far as available. The report also provides background information for the scenario-based simulation provided for in the project "Transformation management for a sustainable water management". Due to its overview character, the study is also likely to be of interest for other interested professionals from science and municipal or municipal economic practice.
content.title_en: Technical possibilities for alternative design of urban water and wastewater infrastructure: a technical research within the framework of the project "Transformation Management for a Sustainable Water Management

content.text: Virtual reality. The small series "Computer Science in Focus" aims to provide "a timely reflection of current developments in computer science in a compact, easy-to-understand form." Like other volumes of the series, the new volume is particularly suitable for computer science students who need a concise summary of the basics and the current state of virtual reality (VR). They get such an overview in the first quarter of the volume, whereby besides software development also input and output devices such as polarization or shutter glasses or data gloves are mentioned. The authors then turn to the VR framework "VR Juggler", which is available for Windows as well as for MacOS X or Linux. After the introduction into this system follow examples and tasks, which describe applications in a very detailed way, especially for scientific purposes and visualizations. Anyone who wants to think about philosophical aspects of VR - inspired by films such as "eXistenZ" - becomes better into the band of B. Woolley: "The Reality of Virtual Worlds" (BA 10/94). (3)
content.title_en: Virtual reality

content.text: Mathematics for computer scientists: algebra, analysis, discrete structures. Introductions to mathematics for computer scientists are, among others, W. Struckmann (ID 2/07) and D. Hachenberger (ID 29/05). This book is aimed at students of computer science in the early semesters. Each chapter begins with concrete terms and situations familiar to the reader and abstracts them to the concepts of modern mathematics. The book is thus similar to D. Hachenberger, who wants to consolidate mathematical school knowledge and then presents this school knowledge in a much more abstract, formal form. The book to be discussed here is divided into the parts algebra, analysis and discrete structures (including basics of mathematics). The individual parts can be independently studied. To each chapter demanding tasks (with short solution sketches in the appendix). The book is therefore also suitable for self-study. The focus is on applications that have a close connection to computer science, e.g. in the operation of spam filters, the administration of large amounts of data with hash tables or the investigation of information efficiently with search engines (2).
content.title_en: Mathematics for Computer scientists : algebra, analysis, discrete structures

content.text: Safe working in laboratories : basic principles and tools for action. This publication contains the regulations on occupational safety and health in laboratories, which are updated by the Technical Committee on Chemistry.
content.title_en: Safe working in laboratories : basics and tools

content.text: Pupils' Dudes, Biology : the specialist dictionary of A - Z. The 7th updated edition is unchanged in page number, presentation and content, so that for libraries which already have the 6th edition (BA 10/06) in existence, no new purchase is necessary. For libraries with the 4th and 5th editions, it is not mandatory to exchange these, but it is recommended to discontinue the 7th edition. (1 A,S)
content.title_en: Pupils' Dudes, Biology : the dictionary of A - Z

content.text: Oracle Survival Guide: [the Swiss knife for Oracle developers and supporters; the most important information on survival in Oracle projects; easy to understand and short explanations, searchable structure of all subject areas, tried-and-tested examples]. Revised and extended by about 60 pages a first-ever title (not displayed here), which is not an introduction to a specific Oracle database system, but a compact tool and reference work for professional database developers in a corresponding field of tasks. Provides for this in a systematic structure (accessed by keyword directory) on the one hand important basic information on the topics SQL, PL/SQL, programming, installation, tools as well as UNIX/Linux, on the other hand explanatory practice examples, tips and tricks. Directs itself to a fairly manageable user group and should be offered in addition where titles are offered to individual Oracle versions or corresponding programming instructions. (3)
content.title_en: Oracle Survival Guide : [the Swiss knife for Oracle developers and supporters; the most important information on survival in Oracle projects; easy to understand and short explanations, retrievable structure of all disciplines, tried-and-tested examples]

content.text: Atlas der Metropole Ruhr : Variety and change of the Ruhr area in the map picture. Over 70 authors from science and practice document the development of the Ruhr area from an important industrial region to the emerging Ruhr region by means of many vivid maps supplemented by photos and informative contributions. The Atlas is divided into 5 major chapters. Starting with overview articles, the authors then deal with history (from the 19th century), structural change and the urban life worlds in the multicultural region. The spatial reorientation of some district cities is illustrated by selected examples, such as the conversion of the Duisburg inner harbour. When reading stöt-, one repeatedly uses interesting, e.g. a chapter on literary sites of the Ruhr area. An altogether clearly written large-format Atlas, the map work, photo book and history book in one is justified. Content and equipment justify the high price. With references and bibliography. No register. For financially strong libraries, also outside the region. (2)
content.title_en: Atlas of the Ruhr metropolis : diversity and change of the Ruhr region in the map

content.text: Biogas measurement program II : 61 biogas plants in comparison ; this work was carried out within the project "Federal programme for the evaluation of novel biomass biogas plants" (Förderkenzeichen: 22003405); the project was financed by the Fachagentur Nachwachsende Rohstoffe e.V. (FNR) with funds from the Federal Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Consumer Protection (BMELV). Overall, the results show that there are large differences between the plants in terms of function, performance and operational safety and in terms of economic efficiency. It is clear that the remuneration of the EEG is not a guarantee for the profitability of the plant operation. The correct dimensioning of the plant in combination with an optimal selection of the fermentation substrate rates is, together with a high utilization of the CHP while simultaneously using the heat generated by the biogas production key for the economic success. Not least, the qualification of the operator plays an important role (source: f.).
content.title_en: Biogas measurement program II : 61 biogas plants in comparison ; this work was carried out within the framework of the project "Federal programme for the evaluation of novel biomass biogas plants" (mark of funding: 22003405) ; the project was financed by the specialized agency Renewable Raw Materials (FNR) with funds from the Federal Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Consumer Protection (BMELV)

content.text: Programming with Wolfram Mathematica [R]. Mathematica is considered an excellent program for numerical and symbolic mathematics. It is constantly being developed by around 500 employees, with thousands of free sample programs ("demonstrations") being put on the Internet. Currently, version 7 is based on which the computer science professor supports. Kilian does not want to provide a manual, but helps the beginner to deal with the program itself, the various auxiliary systems and the most important functions. He does this eloquently, but not far-reachingly. One can see him as a friend who sits next to a user on the computer and gives good advice, what one should pay attention to, which can easily be misunderstood and who finally helps with many commented examples. He also describes freely his own misguided paths. All examples are also available on the Internet. Because of the high price for the program (but there are more favorable offers for students) especially at university and technical locations highly recommended. (3)
content.title_en: Programming with Wolfram Mathematica [R]

content.text: Patterns compact : Design patterns for effective software development. Practical overview for software developers on design patterns (design patterns), which can be used as templates to solve recurring design problems. The narrow, nevertheless very much sought-after volume is already available in 3rd edition and was updated every time considerably by new patterns, the further bibliography. Therefore the preliminary editions (ID 3/07 and ID 44/04) should be replaced. Extensive and completely different is the further title of E. Freeman (BA 4/06), otherwise current comparative literature is missing; for expanded computer science stocks. (3 A)
content.title_en: Patterns compact : Design patterns for effective software development

content.text: The Anti-Mobbing Book : Preventing, recognizing, acting violence at school; [with parent booklet and cyber-mobbing materials]. The bad news: bullying at schools has become a serious and at the same time everyday problem that almost all teachers face in their classes.The need for help is great. The good news: teachers can do something about bullying quickly and sustainably. This book shows how the book shows how to recognise bullying and how teachers and even students can effectively and sustainably tackle bullying themselves.The author's concept consists of various modules for the personal, class and school levels. Numerous worksheets and exercises facilitate the concrete implementation of the measures. - The enclosed parental brochure explains clearly and structured, how to identify bullying and how parents and their children can work together against it.
content.title_en: The Anti-Mobbing Book : Violence at School - Prevent, recognize, act; [with Parent Book and Cyber-Mobbing Materials]

content.text: The southern part of Germany is one of the most varied landscapes on earth. Hardly any other region offers a similar variety of natural spaces in such a narrow area: basic mountains and layered landscapes, the enormous fracture zone of the Upper Rhine ditch and alpine high mountains regions are to be found as well as landscapes characterized by volcanicism, glaciers and meteorite impacts. Southern Germany experienced tropical, subtropical and Arctic climate phases in the last 140 million years, whose traces can be seen in parts of the landscape until today. The authors represent the landscape history of southern Germany in general understandable for a broad reader circle. They design a virtual picture of southern Germany for the individual phases of time. Comparisons - and four-coloured photos - with today's landscapes outside Europe also allow the reader to develop a better idea of the former appearance of southern Germany. In Exkurs Deutschland interesting regional information is conveyed and methods as to be reached by the presented findings are not illustrated in the present 2nd edition, which gives an extensive look at the future of the southern German landscape.
content.title_en: Germany's South from the Middle Ages to the Present

content.text: Physics for engineers for dummies: [for kick with physics; at a glance: finally understand the mathematical basics; understand mechanics and thermodynamics quickly; master optics, electricity, atomic, nuclear and solid physics]. With mechanics, thermodynamics, electromagnetism, optics, atomic, nuclear and solid physics, C. Thomsen deals with the usual areas in 2-semester introductory sessions on the physical basics of natural and engineering sciences. Besides engineers, also secondary students of the natural sciences, teaching candidates, advanced students and interested laypersons can use the book with profit. Only in a few places the mathematical requirements exceed the level of the gymnasial upper level (usually as part of optional supplement sections). Physics students do not get out of the book without further specialized literature with the volume alone (e.g. "modere physics", ID-G 3/10). The individual sections can be used independently of each other. Opposite ("Physics for dummies", ID-G 50/07) are the content-oriented areas of focus. Literature and appetite are missing. For this purpose, the students are given the following examples in the following.
content.title_en: Physics for engineers for dummies : [for kicking with physics ; at a glance: finally understand the mathematical basics ; quickly understand mechanics and thermodynamics ; master optics, electricity, atomic, nuclear and solid state physics]

content.text: The theory of measurement and probability : an introduction. Publisher's text: The book is a compact, easy-to-read introduction to the theory of measurement and integration, including probability theory, which also deals with the important reference to classical analysis for understanding, for example in sections on functions of limited variation or the main proposition of differential and integral calculus. Despite its relatively small extent, it covers all the main topics of these fields, such as quantity systems, quantity functions of measurement, independence, lebesgue-Stieltjes mass, distribution functions, measurable functions, random variable, integral, expectation value, convergence rates, transformation sets, product spaces, set of fubini, dissipation sets, functions of limited variation, main proposition of differential and integral calculus, LP-Räume, conditional expectations, laws of large numbers, ergoden propositions, Martingale, distribution convergence, characteristic functions and the boundary distribution sets of Lindeberg and Feller
content.title_en: Measurement and probability theory : an introduction

content.text: Virtualization and Cloud Computing: Concepts, technology study, market overview. Virtualization and Cloud Computing are currently among the key keywords for IT infrastructure operators. There are a variety of different technologies, products and business models for completely different application scenarios. The present study first provides a detailed overview of current developments in concepts and technologies of virtualization technology – from classic server virtualization to virtual workplace infrastructures to application virtualization and makes an attempt to classify the virtualization variants. When considering the cloud computing concept, its basics and various architecture variants and applications are introduced. The subsequent market overview for virtualization technology shows that the large manufacturers – Citrix, Microsoft and VMware – offer products for almost all virtualization variants and raises crucial differences or the strengths of the existing virtual infrastructure provider. For example, the virtualization of the cloud is very well-referred to the virtualization industry.
content.title_en: Virtualization and Cloud Computing : Concepts, Technology Study, Market Overview

metadata.authors: Meinel, Christoph; Willems, Christian; Roschke, Sebastian

content.text: The research community of the German Research Foundation (DWG) is only gradually able to understand the significance of research data for science and the development of digital research processes. The research community of the German Research Foundation (DWG) is only gradually able to understand the significance of research data for science and the development of digital research processes by means of research research, but also by means of policy and funding. Research data and long-term access to them are of great importance for scientists of all disciplines: as proof of the research process and its results, for re-use in the context of internal and interdisciplinary cooperations or also in relation to comparative analyses, in which research data is researched with new methods or under changed framework conditions. This is all possible only if research data is secured, archived and made available for long-term use. In view of the rapidly increasing digital data volumes of science, social sciences, psycholinguistics, pedagogy, anti-climatics, biodiversity, particle physics and medicine are not yet a widely based inventory. In this study, scientists from eleven disciplines and scientists from the field of research are already involved in the analysis of their current and the topic.
content.title_en: Long-term archiving of research data : an inventory

content.text: Adaptive windows for duplicate detection. Duplicate detection describes the finding of multiple data sets representing the same real world object. This task is not trivial, as (i) the data sets may differ slightly, so that similarity measures are needed for a pair-wise comparison, and (ii) due to the data set a complete pair-wise comparison is not possible. To solve the second problem, there are different algorithms that partition the data set and only make comparisons within the partitions. One of these algorithms is the Sorted Neighborhood Method (SNM), which sorts data by key and then passes a window over the sorted data. Comparisons are only carried out within this window. We describe different variations of the Sorted Neighborhood method based on varying window sizes. These approaches are based on the intuition that areas with larger and smaller similarities exist within the sorted data sets, for which correspondingly larger or smaller window sizes are useful. We describe and evaluate different adaptation strategies as being verifiable in terms of the same type of the original method.
content.title_en: Adaptive windows for duplicate detection

content.text: Development of a regulatory concept for a Federal resource protection law : Research report 3709 18 152 1, UBA-FB 001616 ; [Final report]. This volume presents the results of the research project "Development of a regulatory concept for a Federal resource protection law" carried out on behalf of the Federal Environment Agency. The basis of the regulatory concept is - based on a more detailed definition of the concept of resources - an inventory of resource protection in international, European and German law.
content.title_en: Development of a regulatory concept for a Federal resource protection law : Research report 3709 18 152 1, UBA-FB 001616 ; [Final report]
