content.text: The energy trap: a review of the oil age. The question is not whether fossil fuels (especially oil) are finally, but how soon the sources will finally disappear. 3 years after his considerable debut "Eco-Realism" (BA 2/03), which Gründinger (born 1984) had presented as a senior student, the student of political science and member of Youth for Intergenerational Justice and Sustainability - Europe (YOIS) deals in detail with the explosive energy question. The "pyroman" humanity burns itself, had become a threatening trap due to the dependence on the "black drug oil" from which they can hardly get rid of. His chant on the fossil-atomic energy supply, the critical analysis of the current energy system and his propagated "way into an industrial solar age" (energy revolution) feed out a broad fund of current data and facts from literature, but also secret documents. With bibliography. Like H. Scheer: "Energy autonomy" (HB.A.05) critical of the energy cycle, the current energy cycle, recommended.
content.title_en: The energy trap : a review of the oil age

content.text: Luck, Logic and Bluff: Mathematics in the game; methods, results and limits. As "demanding but very stimulating" speaker Martin A. Lobeck recommended the material- and thought-rich, richly illustrated and equipped with an attractive cover, which has the mathematical background of random, combinatorial and strategic game elements on the topic (1st edition: BA 1/99). About dice, lotto, chess computer, blackjack, reversi, domino or backgammon comes the diploma mathematician and managing director of a game device company to probability calculation, combinatorics and game theory. With all mathematical accurates - even mathematical shy players come to their expense when reading, because they find e.g. precise value-characters for all streets at "Monopoly" and also receive numerous concrete hints on game descriptions. New editions (not shown here) brought improvements and smaller content additions. The now available, by a new approach of game theory extended 4. edition offers the possibility of first or second hand or random purchase of GH.
content.title_en: Happiness, logic and bluff : Mathematics in the game; methods, results and limits

content.text: The silent coup: [How a secret elite of business and politics is tearing Europe and our country under the nail]. New explosive revelation title of the journalist and best-selling author. Once again, the author reveals criminal alliances between business and politics, showing by many examples how corruption and dependencies systematically destroy democratic fundamental values and pillars. (Dagmar Harder) What is happening at present in Greece, Portugal or Spain is only the beginning. Under the guise of consolidating austerity measures to maintain stability and prosperity, in fact, quite different goals are pursued: With massive cuts in education, social and health systems, extreme wage cuts and cutting of workers' rights, a small clique of "elitised" members of politics and economy systematically covers the support of the welfare states and democracy. As already mentioned in its thematically similar title "Spinner Network of Power" (ID-A 22/13; referring to Germany T. Wieczorek: "The Shrewed Republic", ID-A 18/12) exhängungsjournalist and the detaining author Rothtäris again, "The Shrewd Retribution of the Red and the Squad Retribution of the Squad."
content.title_en: The silent coup : [How a secret elite of business and politics is nailing itself to Europe and our country]

content.text: ... suddenly confronted with death: a guide for daycare centers with emergency plans, checklists and help for the funeral accompaniment. Loss, death and mourning are also recurring topics in daycare centers and challenge the pedagogical sensitivity of the educators. A practical book for the funeral support of younger children. (Birgitta Negel-Däuber) Even small children are confronted with death, loss and grief. For daycare centers, the handling of the day care centers on different intensity, depending on how close the deceased person stood to the institution (e.g. the school bus driver, an educator dies after long illness, deadbirth in the family of a child). According to the time course of mourning work, checklists for the first reactions (who is informed?, participation in funeral?) start. Short and long term educational accompaniment, parental work and processing of the mourning case in the group with many suggestions (lieder, rituals, conversations) take up the far largest space. A table on possible reactions of the children, depending on age, a glossary around the topic of death and funeral as well as an excursion of the funeral ritual in the group "Bütub of the other religions.
content.title_en: ... suddenly faced with death : a guide to daycare with emergency plans, checklists and help for grief monitoring

content.text: Object-oriented programming with MATLAB : classes, inheritance, polymorphy ; with 31 tasks and numerous listings. This textbook presents the object-oriented approach of MATLAB. After reading, the readers are able to create software projects in a structured way and manage large amounts of data together with the calculations reasonably. Ideally, the reader should already have a little programming experience, even if the surface and the most important language elements of MATLAB are presented in chapters 1 and 2. Chapter 3 explains the object-oriented programming with MATLAB. Here the central concepts are introduced like classes, properties, methods, data encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphy and handle classes. Chapter 4 contains applications from physics and mechanical engineering. This is intended to deepen the handling of the learned and give further tips for a structured procedure. In conclusion, Chapter 5 provides a command reference and a comparison with other OOP languages. Numerous examples and graphics facilitate and illustrate the handling of MATLAB. The textbook is aimed at students of engineering courses as well as engineers and users in practice.
content.title_en: Object-oriented programming with MATLAB : classes, inheritance, polymorphy ; with 31 tasks and numerous listings

content.text: The volume published for the exhibition of the same name by the Berlin Unterwelten e.V. offers a richly illustrated, multifaceted insight into the gigantomonic plans of the Nazi state for the transformation of Berlin to the "World Capital Germania". Review: The transverse volume (1st edition 2014) in 2nd, updated edition accompanies the exhibition of the same name by the "Berlin Unterwelten e.V." With excellent printed, partly coloured illustrations, it offers a multifaceted insight into the plans of the Nazi state for the redesign of Berlin, which is primarily linked to the name Albert Speer (see G. Sereny: 1995). Short expert essays and expert interviews illuminate the background of the "World Capital Germania" interdisciplinary from historical, architectural, urban and sociological perspectives, and in addition, exemplarily construction projects such as the "Soldatenhalle" are presented as well as existing Nazi buildings in Berlin.
content.title_en: Myth Germania : Vision and crime

content.text: Food hygiene: international standards and guidelines. Among other topics, the topics are the general principles of food hygiene, guidelines for the application of the HACCP system, principles and guidelines for the preparation and application of microbiological criteria for food and the principles and guidelines for the implementation of microbiological risk management. Other topics are the Codex standards for irradiated food, the Code of Procedure for the treatment of food by irradiation, hygienic measures to combat numerous types of viruses such as noroviruses and hepatitis A viruses and hygiene procedures for infant and infant formulas in powder form.
content.title_en: Food hygiene : international standards and guidelines

content.text: Since 1986, the "Classic of modern biological university textbooks" (H. Lüdtke on the 4th edition: ID 9/04), which was already praised for the first German editions as "extremely sovereign and competent representation of practically the entire general biology" and "great textbook of the central area of general biology (Bock), is currently available in 6th edition. Since its last publication, about 5 million scientific articles have appeared on the subject area. Consequently, despite the continued basic structure, the text has been revised considerably: newly discovered functions of RNA molecules, new features on the human genome, stem cell research, cancer therapy etc. In return, the DVD supplement, which also offered the text of the English edition, was referred to video material on the homepage. (3)
content.title_en: Molecular biology of the cell

content.text: Garden travel guide Germany : the 1500 most beautiful gardens and parks. The standard work of garden literature impresses in the 8th edition with a comprehensive and completely revised list of interesting parks, castle gardens and open private gardens throughout Germany. In addition to the detailed description of each plant, the author gives detailed information about garden type, history, design and the respective special features. The layout by federal states as well as the maps for orientation make the garden guide particularly clear. Practical information on opening hours, guided tours, directions, entrance prices and contact addresses complete the volume and make it an indispensable travel companion for all garden lovers
content.title_en: Garden travel guide Germany : the 1500 most beautiful gardens and parks

content.text: Introduction to Java. The current version 9 of the programming language (or more accurately: development platform) Java contains another important innovation: Large programs can now be divided into several modules, which also affects the class library. As in the predecessor to version 8, the development environment NetBeans is used for following the examples. Beginners with programming knowledge and advanced users learn with this book first basics like data types, objects and classes and based on it more special content, for example polymorphy, multithreading, lambda expressions and apps with Android Studio. Very practical, with numerous code examples, which can be downloaded as a zip file from the publisher's homepage, as well as practice tasks with solutions. From the competition titles to this version "Java for Dummies" has been published so far and "Schrödinger programmed Java". The 1st edition can remain in stock, as Java-8 programs under version 9 are running.
content.title_en: Introduction to Java

content.text: The fall of the Habsburg monarchy. Not by a chronologically continuous representation but by an arrangement according to topic fields, the author allows a "look into the depth" of the complex conditions. He "brushes history against the line" and opens up new perspectives on facts that are familiar to him. Review: The Austrian historian has proven himself in numerous publications as an expert on the subject (among others "The First World War", 2011; "Habsburg's dirty war"; 2014). He "likes to brush history against the line". He does not proceed chronologically-developingly, but instead forms thematic blocks such as "The Permanence of Fragility", "Violence Solutions", "Anatomy of Collapse", "The Heritage", etc. Thus he wants to direct the view "from the surface to the depth" to the voices of time witnesses. The danger of simplifying complex conditions is thus hoped to escape. The question repeatedly raised in the abundantly available literature on the 1st World War, whether the Habsburg monarchy was consecrated to the end, or as a state image of survival, can and also offer a supplementary answer to the existing subject.
content.title_en: The Fall of the Habsburg Monarchy
